column2: :skull: An ancient tiny JS and CSS loader from the days before everyone had written one. Unmaintained.

column5:
Merge pull request #22 from valeriansaliou/master

Fixes multiple CSS load issue
Shorter way to fix multiple CSS load issue
Remove links to min and tar.gz files.

Delete lazyload-min.js

People can minify on their own.

Merge pull request #16 from kitcambridge/master

IE 10 Compatibility, Take Two
Fix a Gecko CSS loading bug in the minified JS caused by an unwanted Closure Compiler optimization. [Allex Wang]
Fix a race condition when adding multiple URLs to the "pending" queue.
Save a function call to getEnv() by checking for env in load().
Replace the old PHP-based test scripts with a Node.js Express app.

Fix a silly bug that affected WebKit CSS load detection.

When loading a CSS file on a page without any other stylesheets, load
completion was not detected because the stylesheet's array index is 0,
and an important while loop was testing the index for truthiness.

Reliable CSS load detection for Gecko.

This is based on a technique described by Zach Leatherman and
implemented previously by Oleg Slobodskoi. See Zach's blog post for
details: http://www.zachleat.com/web/2010/07/29/load-css-dynamically/
Use onload for CSS in IE.
Refactor getEnv() for a savings of 94 min+gzip bytes.
Shave some bytes, then add them back by using a more reliable (but longer) isArray check.
Don't cause an error when polling on a page without any CSS. Fixes #2

Set the "async" property of dynamic script nodes to false to preserve execution order in browsers that support it.

This will (hopefully) bring back parallel script loading in Firefox 4 as
soon as it supports this feature.

Scripts are no longer loaded in parallel by default for Firefox 4+ (Gecko 2+).

Gecko 2 as of Firefox 4b7 has intentionally removed support for
preserving the execution order of dynamically-inserted scripts. See
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=591981
Set charset to "utf-8" for dynamically created script and link nodes.
Silly comma. What are you doing there?
Stylesheet load completion is now detected reliably in WebKit by polling document.styleSheets for changes. Thanks to Jonathan Cook for suggesting this solution.
Add a 'lazyload' class to dynamically created script and link nodes so they can be identified later.
Add a README for GitHub's benefit
Oops, looks like a few tabs snuck in
Use separate queues for CSS and JS so they don't block each other
CSS loading is now reliable on all browsers
Remove NaturalDocs script and minified lib
Only load resources in parallel in browsers that ensure execution order (currently Firefox and Opera).
Add CSS support and load resources in parallel (both currently experimental)

- Fix bug that caused the load completion callback to fail to fire in IE if the script was loaded from the cache
- General reliability improvements
- Prepare for 1.0.4 release
Fix a bug that caused the load completion callback to fire immediately in Safari 3.x.
